textAfterTable: DaylilyDiva219 Falls Church, VA (Zone 7a) March 24, 2011 4:47 PM Post #8448065 Holly, I'm sorry your pics are disappearing and hope you figure out what the problem is. Your hellebores are beautiful! I've only begun to expand from the original "nameless" one I got somewhere, sometime, which looks a lot like your #2. It's thriving, and has spread all over the yard. I've since added a double white and a single very dark (almost black) red, which was supposed to be a double white, from... Lowe's! LOL! They're all very young, though, and have only 2 or so stems with blooms at this point. Gitagal Baltimore, MD (Zone 7a) March 24, 2011 6:31 PM Post #8448268 Holly-- I have 4 Hellebore blooming... Unfortunately--since the blooms point down---I cannot get a good picture of them. You must have laid on your stomach on the ground to take the photos you posted! If I had to do that--they would have to call 911 to get me back up! Teee...Heee... Really--WHAT other way couls you get a photo of a Hellebore flower????? The
